item.title: What model to use for rare events
item.description: Introducation In empirical studies, people are worried about rare event situation. That is, when you have, for example, lots of 0’s and only a few 1’s, or vice versa. Do you run a logit model, or do you use a “rare event logit”? When should you use either approach? Or there is a third approach? Paul Allison said in his blog (https://statisticalhorizons.com/logistic-regression-for-rare-events): “Prompted by a 2001 article by King and Zeng, many researchers worry about whether they can legitimately use conventional logistic regression for data in which events are rare.
